Exciting and hard to exit each session.  AI does not seem to be as idiotic yet compared to ATS and the buses are still a mobile road block but at least they are not all empty and needlessly in the way like they are in ATS.

Having spent a substantial 80 hours (rounded up) exploring the vast virtual world of Euro Truck Simulator 2, one can truly appreciate the depth and variety of the game play. From delivering cargo across different countries to building your own trucking empire, the game offers a multitude of engaging activities that will keep you hooked for hours on end.

Furthermore, Euro Truck Simulator 2 has garnered positive reviews from both critics and players alike. Its addictive game play, extensive content, and attention to detail have made it a beloved title in the simulation genre. With regular updates and a dedicated community, the game continues to evolve and provide new experiences for its players.

I would 100% Recommend ETS2 as its frequently updated

This game is litterally the best trucking game ever! The driving experience is realist, the progression system is nice with employees you can hire to develop your company and the map is beautiful. There are a lot of mods which can enhance even more your trucking experience! I highly recommend this game! :D
One of the two best truck simulators for PC existing, IMHO

When you start your own fleet and begin expanding the business, the game truly becomes a fantastic experience. At this point, one can't help but think it would have been great if fleet and business management were more detailed.

Additionally, it would be good to see the following:

- I believe that in a game at this level, there should be serious weather conditions. Rain, snowstorms should occur and affect the experience.

- Everywhere is too clean; there should be dusty roads and paths.

- Some cities, like Germany, France, Spain, should be designed much larger, with more detailed roads and paths on those maps. For example, we should be able to get stuck in narrow streets.

Still the best and realistic driving game you could ever wish for. Even without using any mods it's still a delightful game to just chill out with. There's an incredible amount of customisation which allows you to play the game as you wish.

Amazing game. Entertaining, relaxing, therapeutic...

The game really delivers when it comes to the overall simulation experience. You'll learn about trucks and truck modifications, Europe's geography, many types of trailers and different cargo types, fuel consumption and fuel economy, and lots more.

Not only you are given the truck driving simulation experience, this game also provides that much needed (for most people) sense of progress, by allowing you to build your own truck company from the ground up, buying more tucks and hiring people to work for you. It's just amazing.
i like this game but is laging

Euro Truck Simulator 2 is a standout in the simulation genre. It offers an immersive experience of driving across a condensed but vast representation of Europe. The game’s economic sandbox is simple yet resonant, allowing you to start as a low-skilled, truckless lorry jockey and gradually amass funds to buy your first rig and rent your first yard. The game becomes even more engaging as you start hiring drivers, upgrading skills, and customizing your truck. However, the game can become monotonous if you don’t purchase any map DLCs. Despite this, the game remains addictive and rewarding, especially with the addition of the unofficial mod for mass multiplayer, TruckersMP.
Great game, the AI traffic is a bit annoying but overall best simulation game so far.

I used to make fun of people who played games like Farm Simulator or Flight Simulator so imagine my surprise when I got this and American Truck Simulator in a Humble Bundle, decided to download it, and actually enjoyed it. The game has a simple premise: deliver cargo while building a trucking empire. I like to turn the volume down in game and listen to my Sturgill Simpson playlist on Spotify (Sound & Fury is the best album for trucking). It is a relaxing game that you can let your mind wander to or even passively meditate to.

This game has given me many relaxed hours, and will probably give me many more. 
It's somehow so chill to pick up some cargo and drive it from one end of Europe to the next while listening to music or a podcast. No expectations, just drive. :P

Great game to cool off after a long day of work... simply grab a drink, connect your wheel, shifter and pedals if you have any, sit down, and enjoy the game. No pressure, no stress, just driving for as long as you feel like.

Whilst the base game is really enjoyable itself, a plethora of mods available on the web do a great job at adding onto the game and giving more things (such as for example cars) to explore.

There's no need to even try hard at the game; that's not what I do either. Just play it every once in a while, and you will definitely start to enjoy it.

That being said, thank you to the devs for releasing this game almost 12 years ago. I am looking forward to further expansions/projects.

Euro Truck simulator has everything, which are the other simulators wishes it could be. Never has a game immersed me in the experience of hauling improperly secured materials in a truck before. Every speed bump had me on the edge of my seat praying for mercy. The music is absolutely banging and you will not get sick of it. I like how the developer keeps this game fresh by using a different mechanic to indicate target areas every few levels, so you'll never know what to expect. This game has it all.

One of the best simulators of all my life (and trust me… I've used a lot!). I don't think that there should be much more to say…
I am playing this simulator since early 2019, and I've been driving almost every night ever since! I find it very relaxing! On the Mac (macOS 10.12 Sierra) there is the unescapable limitation of being forced to use OpenGL as graphic engine, which – compared to DX on Windows OS –  is quite limitating and slower, but all in all the Sim is fascinating and keeps its incredible grace and beauty thanks to the developers who never stopped working (hence releasing updates) even for a single week!!
Definitely recommended to almost everyone who likes driving in the most relaxed way!
Happy trucking! :)

=============
EDIT (March 18, 2023): I have recently bought a gaming PC, a quite powerful computer with a 4K monitor, and I must say... this simulator (along with its 'brother' [b]American Truck Simulator[/b]) has become amazingly awesome!!

I drive trucks for a living, and I pride myself on having a serious trucker bladder. I had just finished a 500 mile stretch and really felt like I had a full bladder. So I stopped at a TA and went to take a piss. Well when I walk into the bathroom every urinal is full, and the middle one is taken by an ultimate chad, 6'4, jawline could cut glass. This dude was pissing so hard it probably left a groove in the back of the urinal. Like you could hear the piss bouncing off of the urinal hard as fuck. And it was a steady steam. Usually I wouldn't piss in a urinal because my bladder is beta as fuck and doesn't like to pee unless I have privacy, but I had to piss so bad that as soon as one opened I went for it. I knew of course that I was going to piss mog everyone in there because my bladder was full and I can probably keep a soft stream for a minute and a half with a full bladder (something I pride myself on). Of course the urinal that opened was right next to chad. So at least I was happy that since he had been pissing for at least 30 seconds since I walked in there to the time that the urinal next to him was clear, that I would be able to piss mog the shit out of him. Well I unzip and try my hardest to start peeing, but my beta bladder only let out like three embarrassing spurts. I could tell he kinda looked at me too, like, having trouble there bud? So I held my breath cause I know that helps jump start a shy bladder. Well my face was red as fuck cause I was straining so hard to pee and holding my breath. I was literally seeing spots. Then my beta fucking lower intestine lets out a queef sounding fart cause I'm straining so hard. I swear Chad almost chuckled before letting out the longest, deepest sounding fart I'd ever heard. So not bad enough to piss mog me, he has to fart mog me too. All the while without a single break in the hardest pressured stream I've ever heard. For at least a minute so far since I'd walked in. Finally I get my stream started and it's slow as fuck cause I'm straining so hard just to pee. So I'm like okay, this dudes been pissing hard enough to cut concrete for a minute straight, no way he's gonna piss longer than me. This fucking ultimate Chad continues pissing hard enough to spray civil rights protesters for another minute after that, while I pitifully spurt out beta puffs of clear piss. I'm sure his was a nuclear orange color from STDs, liquor, and testosterone. So this man CNC water jet cuts into this urinal for 2 minutes straight that I witnessed, not counting however long he was pissing before I walked in there, while im spurt spurting clear piss that barely reaches the lip of the urinal. Meanwhile he has a complete unbroken stream even with a ripping alpha baritone fart. Then, I shit you not, this motherfucker proceeds to sneeze. Without. Breaking. Stream. I literally did not know that was possibly. But this man sneezes and doesn't break stream. I'm pretty sure he kept his eyes open while he sneezed too, but I couldn't tell because his hunter eyes were already such small slits with no visible upper eyelid. Then, I'm like well I have at least 30-45 seconds of solid stream left. I'm literally counting down the seconds. Feeling my bladder get lower and lower, and In the silent room all I can hear is the sound of a rushing dam of water slamming against his urinal. There's literally a line forming to the urinals, everyone else that was pissing had already cycled out and washed hands and left, it's just me and Chad and 4 new guys pissing, and I'm praying the whole time like please God this man was pissing before I even walked in here please don't make me run out before him. Well of course I run out and zip up in shame as he continues to Bull Connor the fuck out of that urinal like it was a black man in the 60s. Then I shamefully turn to wash my hands as another beta rushes into my spot at the urinal. Literally not even any of the fresh pissers were peeing as hard as chad. And the bathroom had a full size mirror above the sinks, and Chad with his fucking hunter eyes and grin is knowingly staring into my soul through the mirror while I wash my hands. So I can't really make eye contact with myself either in a mirror, so I just intensely focused on my hands while I washed them. Then I start the blow dryer, and meanwhile 4 guys have cycled in and out of the urinals and Chad is still pissing. I swear to god I could hear that fire hose stream over the blow dryer. And it wasn't a normal dryer, it was one of those jet ones that puts a dent in your skin while you use it. I shamefully walked out with my head down and as the door swung shut I could still hear him pissing. I walked around and got a drink, some ibuprofen (high blood pressure from straining to piss give me a headache) and put diesel on the pump. This dude finally walks out of the bathroom, hands dry and long sleeves still down (no need to wash hands when you're chad), as I'm leaving the store. Then this dude proceeds to the trucker section if the truck stop and climbs into the biggest meanest looking peterbuilt I've ever seen, pulling doubles, and back the doubles up into a tight parking spot without even getting out to look . Meanwhile I'm pulling a tiny little automatic semi with a short trailer and I was too scared to try and fit into a parking spot so I just drove until I found a rest area that had a pull through open. The game is good but the support is biased by politics !
The DLC "Heart of Russia" has been announced 3 years ago, but the dev team of this game is definitely mixing gaming and politics, and removing all questions related to when the developm of this DLC will finally stopped being ignored.

They announce many new regions since then, and when we question why those new regions (Nordic being the latest announcement, despite Scandinavia DLC being already out and purchased) get worked on when old awaited ones are frozen, the question gets deleted from the forum.

UPDATE: Got banned from their forum for a month as I wrote in forum that I don't want to hear about political reasons as an excuse for "Heart of Russia" expansion not being worked on (was announced 3 years ago, and other DLCs are worked on, released since). Justification of the ban : "Political baiting" when i was specifically mentioning myself that I don't want to see political baiting used as an excuse..

I have pver 20 DLCs for this game already, over 2000 games on Steam platform, and it makes me regret I send my money to peoples who mix politics and gaming.

An amazing game, with lots of possibilities. Very calming and relaxing, therapeutic game-play. You can take it as serious or as chill as you want. With mods you can fully customise anything you want about the game, from visuals, to maps, to truck specs, to fully custom vehicles and game-play. There is a massive community of people who constantly improve and increase the mods library with any mod you can think of, or you can find mods online (although those aren't updated for newer versions as often and sometimes not at all). Works beautifully on modern and relatively old machines with and without mods. I personally always have at least 50 active and are able to run it on both my pc and laptop. I have played on keyboard and mouse and with a sim setup, and both are amazing (although a wheel and pedals are recommended for the best experience). Friends who I have recommended it too also love this game. Only issue is that sometimes on certain parts of the map the game crashes, however I am 99% certain it's due to a faulty mod. Loading times do also increase with the addition of mods, especially physics and visual ones. But the game is generally very stable. Overall a very enjoyable game to just pass time, have fun driving cool trucks or just to relax after a long stressful day.

Euro Truck Simulator 2 is a simulation video game that allows players to experience exciting and realistic truck driving across Europe. This game offers an outstanding experience for simulation driving enthusiasts and provides plenty of opportunities to explore diverse landscapes, cities, and roads.

One of the most striking aspects of the game is the detailed environmental design that provides a sense of reality while driving through different European countries. Each city has its authentic architecture, traffic signs, and atmosphere, making each drive unique.

As a truck driver, players have the opportunity to experience various aspects of driving, including managing cargo, maintaining vehicles, and driving through different weather conditions. Additionally, the ability to customize trucks and various aspects of driving adds depth to the game and allows players to personalize their experience according to their preferences.

One of the most interesting aspects of the game is the economic system that allows players to develop their own business empire by purchasing trucks, hiring employees, and expanding their fleet across Europe. This provides a long-term goal and motivation for further exploration and progress in the game.

The game also supports player-created mods, which further enriches the experience and allows the community to share their ideas and creations.

Overall, Euro Truck Simulator 2 is an outstanding simulation game that provides deeply satisfying truck driving experience through beautiful European landscapes. With its impressive graphics, realistic physics, and rich content, this game will appeal to simulation driving enthusiasts and provide hours of entertainment and exploration.

Overview:
Euro Truck Simulator 2 (ETS2) is a captivating simulation game developed and published by SCS Software. Released in 2012, it has garnered a dedicated fan base and remains one of the most popular truck simulation games to date. Set in Europe, players embark on a journey to build their own trucking empire, transporting goods across vast landscapes and realistic road networks.

Graphics and Audio:
ETS2 boasts impressive graphics, with detailed truck models, realistic environments, and dynamic weather effects that add depth to the immersive experience. The audio design is equally remarkable, featuring authentic engine sounds, ambient noises, and a soothing soundtrack that enhances the atmosphere of long-haul trucking.

Gameplay:
At its core, ETS2 offers a deeply satisfying gameplay loop centered around truck driving. Players start as freelance drivers, taking on jobs to earn money and experience. As they progress, they can purchase their own trucks, hire drivers, and expand their fleet to become a renowned transportation company. The gameplay is both relaxing and challenging, requiring players to navigate various road conditions, manage fuel consumption, and adhere to traffic laws and delivery deadlines.

Realism:
One of the game's strongest aspects is its commitment to realism. From meticulously recreated cities and landmarks to authentic truck handling physics, ETS2 captures the essence of the trucking experience. The inclusion of licensed trucks from renowned manufacturers further adds to the authenticity, allowing players to customize their rigs to their liking.

Modding Community:
One of the defining features of ETS2 is its vibrant modding community. Players can access a plethora of user-created mods, ranging from new truck models and custom paint jobs to additional maps and gameplay enhancements. This extends the game's longevity and provides endless opportunities for customization and exploration.

Multiplayer:
In addition to its single-player mode, ETS2 offers multiplayer functionality, allowing players to team up with friends or strangers in a shared trucking experience. Whether collaborating on deliveries or competing in trucking events, multiplayer adds a new dimension to the gameplay, fostering camaraderie and friendly competition among players.

Conclusion:
Euro Truck Simulator 2 stands as a testament to the enduring appeal of simulation games. With its impressive visuals, engaging gameplay, and commitment to realism, it offers a truly immersive trucking experience that keeps players coming back for more. Whether you're a seasoned trucking enthusiast or a newcomer to the genre, ETS2 is a must-play title that delivers hours of enjoyment and exploration.

When I purchased this a few years ago on sale for 5$, I didn't think much of it. I had seen it advertised often enough and figured "trucks are cool, I may as well give it a shot, what can go wrong for 5$". I had no idea the extent this and ATS would have me enamoured to. 

Now, with over 1k hours in each game I can safely say this has effectively taken a prime spot in my gaming hobby. SCS is one of those game companies in the minority of which you can trust to do what they can for the game, not their pocket book. From the shout out to old school simming on the baseline in-game tires company called "Dynamix", to the daunting live representation of a living breathing world which they constantly innovate and keep current, you can see their commitment to this games integrity.

I know many people that play with a full sim setup with an H-shifter, steering wheel, multiple screens etc. But I can play casually with a controller and still have the realistic trucking experience just as easily. I won't go too in detail about the workings of the game, but if you like semi trucks in any way shape or form, this game and/or it's sister American Truck Sim are for you. Have enjoyed 4+ years of watching this game develop and participating in the various live in-game events they do for holidays and new DLC. Looking forward to more realistic features they have been experimenting with as well, such as the possibility of adding a fully seasonal celestial cycle complete with the appropriate weather simulation.

Your driver is a picture
You have no visible hands
You can never leave the cabin
You need to sleep, but not eat
Your company drivers are pictures
You can not put your company name on your trucks
And you never see your company trucks on the road
You can not hire who you like when you like, as the driver pool rotate
You can not buy what you want when you want, as it is level locked
All the trucks are old. Even the "new" trucks are NOS (new old stock)
You can not drive a rigid, dump, box car or pick up trucks
There are no exhaust smoke, visible damage or dirt
You ALWAYS get stopped at customs
The GPS is in dire need of updating
The economy is broken
Weight limits are broken
Physics are very broken
The AI is severely broken and the list goes on and on and on.

The game is in many ways a joke, but it does have some redeeming features, so the negativity is actually for the greedy developers that really are a joke and not the game itself.

The base game is as bare bones as possible so they can sell a DLC for every little thing, such as a flag in your window, a paint job, new tires, complete Steam achievements and of course a new map. 

ETS 2 have 4 complete and 2 partial countries out of the 44 that is Europe in the base game.
The rest is only available if you give them your credit card.
ATS only have 3 of the 50 states and every DLC for a state / country cost more than the game
It does not help that there are over 100 of them available for both games, and every time they get less content and worse quality.
Or when the Ukraine war started they heavily promoted the Ukrainian skin pack, and put the Heart of Russia DLC that was scheduled to come on indefinite hold.
It does not help that there are no real life brands in the game to avoid paying for copyrights, but there are real life advertisements, since SCS get paid to put them in either.
Or that every state / country are made from the same copy / pasted roads, buildings and scenery, rearranged to look more similar to what ever place they are making, with some newly made street signs and a couple of non copyrighted landmarks before they call it a day
Or that the most famous landmarks such as the Eiffel tower are missing.

"Those landmarks are not included by design. It was a hard decision, made as a result of due to discussing that case in details in past, especially while creating previous DLC Vive La France, where as you may notice, there is Eiffel Tower not included.
As the game includes "Truck" in the name, we made the decision, to show the city from truck driver perspective. Trucks are not allowed to enter city centers, and mentioned landmarks are neither super high nor located on the hills, to be visible from industrial areas. So that they are not visible in the game." piotr  [developer] Posted: 6 Dec, 2017

If that is true, why is it only copyrighted landmarks that are not included ?

SCS is NOT a small indie company either as some like you to believe. 
They have 400 employees and had over 50 million USD in assets and 13 million USD in net income in 2019.
They are just another greedy company that even EA would be proud of.

Prepare to embark on an unforgettable journey across the stunning landscapes of Europe in Euro Truck Simulator 2, a masterpiece of simulation gaming that delivers an unparalleled experience of life on the open road.

From the moment you start your engine, you're transported into the driver's seat of a meticulously detailed truck, ready to explore a vast and diverse continent. Whether you're cruising through the picturesque countryside of France, navigating the bustling streets of Germany, or winding your way through the majestic mountains of Switzerland, every journey is a breathtaking adventure.

But Euro Truck Simulator 2 is much more than just a driving game—it's a true simulation of the trucking industry. From managing your own trucking company to customizing your fleet of vehicles, every aspect of the game is meticulously crafted to provide an authentic and immersive experience. Whether you're delivering cargo across Europe or expanding your business empire, the depth and complexity of the gameplay will keep you coming back for more.

One of the game's standout features is its stunning attention to detail. From the realistic truck physics to the lifelike AI traffic, every element of the game has been finely tuned to create a truly immersive experience. Whether you're cruising down the highway at sunset or navigating through a bustling city center, the world of Euro Truck Simulator 2 feels alive and vibrant.

But perhaps the most impressive aspect of Euro Truck Simulator 2 is its vibrant modding community. With a wealth of user-created content available, including new trucks, maps, and gameplay mechanics, the game offers endless opportunities for players to customize and enhance their experience.

In conclusion, Euro Truck Simulator 2 is a true masterpiece of simulation gaming. With its stunning visuals, realistic gameplay, and endless opportunities for exploration and customization, it's a must-play for fans of the genre. So grab your keys, hit the road, and prepare for the journey of a lifetime!

[h3]Euro Truck Simulator 2 - The Pinnacle of Virtual Trucking Realism[/h3]

Rating: ⭐⭐⭐⭐⭐

"Euro Truck Simulator 2" stands as a true masterpiece in the realm of simulation gaming, delivering an unparalleled and immersive experience for virtual trucking enthusiasts. Developed by SCS Software and continuously refined since its release, ETS2 combines meticulous attention to detail, expansive landscapes, and a genuine love for the art of trucking.

[b]Realism and Authenticity:[/b]
The cornerstone of ETS2's success lies in its commitment to realism. From the authentic driving physics to the intricately recreated European road network, every aspect of the game reflects a dedication to replicating the true trucking experience. Adhering to traffic laws, managing fuel consumption, and navigating dynamic weather conditions contribute to the game's unparalleled sense of authenticity.

[b]Expansive and Diverse Map:[/b]
The vast and diverse map of Europe serves as the canvas for players to embark on their trucking adventures. The meticulously crafted cities, countryside, and landmarks create a visual feast that keeps players engaged and eager to explore new territories. The constant expansion of the map through downloadable content ensures that the journey is ever-evolving.

[b]Detailed Customization Options:[/b]
The customization options available for trucks allow players to create a fleet that reflects their personal style. From choosing the type of truck and trailer to applying unique paint jobs, the level of detail in customization enhances the feeling of ownership and connection to the virtual trucks.

[b]Economic Simulation and Progression:[/b]
ETS2's economic simulation adds depth to the gameplay, turning each delivery into a strategic venture. Earning money, expanding the trucking business, and managing a fleet of drivers contribute to a sense of progression that keeps players invested in the long run.

[b]Modding Community and Continuous Support:[/b]
The active modding community has played a pivotal role in extending the lifespan of ETS2. The support from both the developers and the community ensures that players have access to a wealth of enhancements, including visual improvements, additional trucks, and gameplay modifications.

In conclusion, "Euro Truck Simulator 2" is a testament to the power of meticulous design and a passionate community. Its commitment to realism, expansive landscapes, and ongoing support make it the definitive virtual trucking experience. Whether you're a simulation enthusiast or someone looking for a unique and relaxing gaming adventure, ETS2 deserves its place among the highest echelons of gaming excellence.

"Euro Truck Simulator 2" - це захоплююча симуляція водіння вантажівок, яка вражає своєю реалістичністю та деталізацією. Розроблена SCS Software, гра привертає увагу своїм унікальним підходом до симуляції вантажівочного транспорту та дозволяє гравцеві відчути атмосферу дорожнього перевезення в Європі.

Однією з ключових переваг гри є реалістична фізика руху та величезна кількість деталей відтворених вантажівок і доріг. Водіння великих тягачів по реальних європейських містах та трасах надає відчуття справжньої професійної діяльності водія вантажівки. Відмінною особливістю є можливість вибору різних моделей вантажівок та їх налаштувань, що робить гру ще більш персоналізованою.

Гра також вражає своєю величезною кількістю доступних місій та завдань, які охоплюють різноманітні аспекти вантажоперевезень: від міських доставок до міжнародних перевезень великого вантажу. Це додає грі різноманітності та стимулює гравця до розвитку свого власного транспортного бізнесу.

Невід'ємною частиною "Euro Truck Simulator 2" є реалістична графіка та деталізовані міські пейзажі, які надають гравцеві враження від подорожі по різноманітним європейським локаціям. Режим віртуального реалізму, включаючи відобразження погоди та циклічність дня і ночі, створює ще більше іммерсії.

Однак, можливо, деяким гравцям може здатися, що в грі трошки монотонно, особливо на початкових етапах розвитку кар'єри водія. Тим не менше, для шанувальників симуляторів та тих, хто цінує відчуття великої відстані та відповідальності, "Euro Truck Simulator 2" стане захоплюючим віртуальним водійським досвідом.

This game came back to life when they created the convoy sessions. Well, after several years they still haven't done anything to increase the maximum of 8 players. Not only that, but the convoy session system is a complete joke, both the sessions created with the game and the dedicated server sessions. They have not fixed the known bugs in the game, such as the fact that you can join a WOT route with your own trailer without hooking it up and being in a distant city, which forces everyone to cancel the route, or that you go to the workshop and have to leave the repair area and re-enter so that the checkpoint in the mechanic's menu is activated, or that you can configure a truck at the dealership without having spaces to buy it and that it does not tell you at least one warning when starting the purchase configuration, etc Instead of fixing what's important, they start making paid DLCs for people to buy. They are losing players because of that, they are working on things to get people to spend money on the game and they are kicking out all the players. It's a real shame because the game looked very good when they started the convoy session system, it's a shame that they left what revived the game halfway and gave priority to other things.

European Truck Simulator 2 (ETS2) is a masterpiece in the simulation genre, offering an immersive and surprisingly enjoyable experience that goes beyond the mundane task of driving a truck across the continent. As an avid fan of simulation games, I found ETS2 to be a captivating blend of realism, meticulous attention to detail, and a surprisingly therapeutic gaming experience.

One of the standout features of ETS2 is its meticulously crafted world. The game recreates the European landscape with remarkable accuracy, showcasing iconic landmarks, diverse cities, and picturesque countryside. From the bustling streets of Paris to the serene landscapes of Scandinavia, each location feels unique and adds a layer of authenticity to the overall gaming experience. The attention to detail is commendable, making every journey a visual delight.

The driving mechanics in ETS2 are both realistic and accessible. The weight and handling of the trucks are accurately simulated, providing a satisfying sense of control for those seeking a true-to-life experience. However, the game also caters to players of varying skill levels, offering adjustable difficulty settings and customizable controls. This balance makes ETS2 accessible to both simulation enthusiasts and casual gamers looking for a relaxing experience.

One of the game's strengths is its economic simulation aspect. Starting with a small trucking company, players must manage finances, expand their fleet, and take on various jobs to turn a profit. The strategic decision-making involved in choosing routes, managing fuel costs, and upgrading vehicles adds a layer of complexity that keeps the gameplay engaging and rewarding.

ETS2 also boasts a vibrant modding community that continually enhances the game's content. From additional truck models to realistic weather mods, the community contributions extend the longevity and replayability of the game, allowing players to tailor their experience to their preferences.

The sound design in ETS2 deserves special mention. The engine sounds, ambient noises, and radio stations contribute to the immersive atmosphere, enhancing the sense of actually being on the road. The radio stations, featuring a diverse range of music genres and entertaining discussions, add a touch of realism and provide a welcome companion during long drives.

While ETS2 excels in many areas, it's not without its minor flaws. The AI of other vehicles on the road can occasionally be erratic, and the absence of real-time traffic updates might seem like a missed opportunity. However, these issues are minor in comparison to the overall excellence of the game.

In conclusion, European Truck Simulator 2 is a triumph in the simulation genre. Its attention to detail, realistic gameplay mechanics, and the sheer joy of exploring Europe behind the wheel of a truck make it a must-play for fans of simulation games. Whether you're a truck enthusiast or someone looking for a unique and relaxing gaming experience, ETS2 delivers an unforgettable journey across the beautiful landscapes of Europe.

As a fan of driving simulators, I found Euro Truck Simulator 2 to be a refreshing and enjoyable experience. The game provides a realistic and immersive trucking experience, allowing players to navigate the vast landscapes of Europe while hauling cargo across different cities. The realistic physics and detailed environments make it feel as if you're actually behind the wheel of a big rig.

One of the most impressive aspects of Euro Truck Simulator 2 is its sheer size and scope. The game covers a vast area of Europe, with over 60 cities to explore. The developers have put a lot of effort into making each location feel unique and authentic, from the bustling streets of London to the quaint villages of the countryside.

In addition to the main game, Euro Truck Simulator 2 has a large number of downloadable content (DLC) expansions. These expansions add new maps, trucks, cargo types, and other features to the game. This means that there is always something new to explore and experience, keeping the gameplay fresh and engaging.

Overall, I found Euro Truck Simulator 2 to be a well-crafted and enjoyable game. It's a great choice for fans of driving simulators or anyone looking for a relaxing and immersive experience.

Here are some of the most popular Euro Truck Simulator 2 DLC expansions:

* **Scandinavia:** This expansion adds Sweden, Norway, and Denmark to the game, giving players a chance to explore the stunning landscapes of the Nordic countries.

* **Vive La France!:** This expansion adds France to the game, with detailed recreations of iconic landmarks such as the Eiffel Tower and the Arc de Triomphe.

* **Beyond the Baltic Sea:** This expansion adds Estonia, Latvia, and Lithuania to the game, offering players a chance to experience the Baltic states' rich history and culture.

* **Italy:** This expansion adds Italy to the game, with stunning recreations of Rome, Florence, and Venice.

* **Going East!:** This expansion adds Poland, Slovakia, the Czech Republic, and Hungary to the game, providing players with a chance to explore the heart of Central Europe.

* **High Power Cargo Pack:** This expansion adds new cargo types to the game, such as oversized loads and dangerous goods.


If you're looking for a relaxing and immersive driving simulator, I highly recommend Euro Truck Simulator 2. With its vast map, realistic physics, and numerous DLC expansions, there's something for everyone to enjoy.

If you're looking to complete the in game achievements I would advise only using the cargo DLC packs when you start the game. Uncheck the map expansion DLC in game preferences and play the game on the base map to get achievements like discover 100% of the map (Pathfinder). There are many more achievements to get while using the base map only to make things easier like owning a garage in every city.

Euro Truck Simulator 2--one of the best tranquil games I hit up when I'm tired of playing action games. Taking control of a big wheeler and cruising to my job's destination, breathing in all the beautiful sceneries along the way, is a feeling that I'm a real, genuine tough-as-nails trucker... until I dent the rear bumper of a Honda Accord from not staying focused. There is a multiplayer mod which I haven't gotten to yet; personally I enjoy the single campaign as is, and I usually am the online type. Speed limits must be obeyed or face contract penalties. This is not Grand Theft Auto 5. 

Saving up $$$ to buy my own truck without taking out a loan! 

*** i7 920, 6GB RAM, GTX 295 (replacing it with EVGA GTX 750 Ti SC in a couple of days after four years). Game runs flawlessly, so older cards will work. ***

Euro Truck Simulator 2 (ETS2) is a masterpiece of simulation gaming that manages to turn the seemingly mundane task of trucking into a thoroughly entertaining and enjoyable experience. Developed by SCS Software, this game takes players on an immersive journey across the diverse landscapes of Europe, delivering a nice and entertaining blend of realism and relaxation.

The sheer attention to detail in Euro Truck Simulator 2 is commendable. From the meticulously recreated cities to the lifelike traffic patterns, every aspect of the game contributes to an authentic trucking experience. The vehicles themselves are intricately modeled, with a wide variety of licensed trucks from renowned manufacturers, each offering a unique driving feel.

One of the game's key strengths lies in its simplicity. Euro Truck Simulator 2 provides a straightforward premise – drive a truck, pick up and deliver cargo – and executes it with finesse. The controls are intuitive, making it accessible for both simulation enthusiasts and casual gamers. The learning curve is gentle, allowing players to focus on the joy of the journey rather than wrestling with complex mechanics.

The heart of Euro Truck Simulator 2 is the vast and beautifully rendered open-world map of Europe. From the bustling streets of Paris to the serene countryside of Scandinavia, each location is a visual treat. The day-night cycle and dynamic weather add a layer of immersion, making every trip unique and offering a pleasant change of scenery during long hauls.

The game's economic system and progression mechanics are well-balanced, providing a sense of achievement with each successful delivery. As players accumulate wealth, they can expand their trucking empire by hiring drivers, buying new trucks, and upgrading their garages. This gradual progression ensures a steady stream of goals to pursue, keeping the gameplay engaging and rewarding.

Euro Truck Simulator 2 also benefits from a dedicated modding community, allowing players to enhance their experience with a myriad of user-created content. Whether it's adding new trucks, tweaking gameplay mechanics, or introducing custom map expansions, the modding scene adds longevity to the game and caters to a wide range of preferences.

While Euro Truck Simulator 2 may not be action-packed or feature intense gameplay, its charm lies in its ability to offer a relaxing and satisfying experience. The game's calming pace, combined with its attention to detail, makes it an ideal choice for players seeking a nice and entertaining escape from the more frenetic titles in the gaming world. Euro Truck Simulator 2 proves that the joy of the open road and the simple pleasure of trucking can be a captivating and thoroughly enjoyable gaming experience.

A Masterpiece of Realism and Relaxation

This game has captivated players worldwide with its attention to detail, expansive virtual world, and an immersive driving experience that transcends the mundane. As someone who has delved into the world of ETS2, I can confidently say that it's not just a game; it's a joyous journey through meticulously crafted landscapes and a celebration of the art of trucking.

One of the most striking aspects of Euro Truck Simulator 2 is the sheer authenticity embedded in every pixel of its virtual world. From the meticulously recreated trucks to the diverse landscapes spanning across Europe, the game sets a new standard for realism in the simulation genre. The attention to detail is awe-inspiring, with accurately modeled cities, realistic weather conditions, and a day-night cycle that adds an extra layer of immersion.

The variety of trucks available in ETS2 is a truck enthusiast's dream come true. Each vehicle is meticulously designed, showcasing the unique characteristics of different manufacturers. Whether you're navigating the winding roads of the Alps or cruising down the autobahn, the sensation of being behind the wheel of a powerful truck is remarkably well-captured. The realistic physics engine further enhances the driving experience, making every turn, acceleration, and braking maneuver feel authentic.

The game's expansive map, featuring a vast network of roads connecting cities and countries, adds a sense of grandeur to the overall experience. From the bustling urban landscapes to the serene countryside, ETS2 offers a diverse range of environments to explore. The attention to detail in recreating iconic landmarks and landscapes is commendable, making each journey a visual treat. As you traverse through the various regions, the game seamlessly transitions between different terrains, creating a dynamic and engaging driving experience.

One of the most appealing aspects of Euro Truck Simulator 2 is the level of customization it offers to players. From choosing your truck's make and model to customizing its appearance and performance, the game allows you to create a personalized virtual trucking experience. The extensive array of tuning options and accessories ensures that each player can tailor their vehicle to suit their preferences, adding a layer of personalization that enhances the sense of ownership.

The career progression system in ETS2 is both rewarding and immersive. Starting as a novice trucker, players gradually build their own trucking empire by completing deliveries, expanding their fleet, and establishing a successful logistics company. The economic aspect of the game adds a strategic element, as players must manage their finances, invest wisely, and adapt to the ever-changing market conditions. This layer of depth keeps players engaged and invested in the long-term success of their virtual trucking business.

Beyond the technical aspects, Euro Truck Simulator 2 excels in creating a relaxing and meditative gaming experience. The open roads, accompanied by a soothing soundtrack, create an atmosphere of tranquility. Whether you're embarking on a short delivery or undertaking a cross-country journey, the game's pacing encourages players to appreciate the beauty of the virtual landscapes and the joy of the open road.

The multiplayer aspect of ETS2 adds a social dimension to the game, allowing players to connect and collaborate with others in the expansive virtual world. The cooperative gameplay, combined with the realistic convoy mechanics, enhances the sense of camaraderie among the virtual trucking community. Participating in convoys with friends or fellow players adds a layer of fun and camaraderie, turning the solitary act of trucking into a shared adventure.

In conclusion, Euro Truck Simulator 2 stands out as a masterpiece in the simulation genre, offering a harmonious blend of realism, relaxation, and personalization. The meticulous attention to detail, expansive virtual world, and immersive driving experience make it a standout title that continues to captivate players worldwide. Whether you're a truck enthusiast or a casual gamer looking for a unique and enjoyable experience, ETS2 is a must-play game that delivers joyous journeys on the open road.

Holy damn, I bought this and all the DLC as I adore ATS and I thought this would be the equivalent in Europe, but everything feels very inferior to that former experience - both in atmosphere and also visuals. Started in Poland and was absolutely shocked how hideous the visuals are compared to ATS - what a first impression to the impressive vistas in the USA, disgusting! Where is the sense of scale, too - they haven't balanced density for that visceral experience! The environments, too, look so artificial as asset sets, they're rather 'PS2' tier in quality! Maybe it's redeemed in modding, or it use to be high to people's standards, but it's horribly outdated currently - quality seems inconsistent everywhere and so evidently needs a reboot from the GROUND UP.

This obviously needs a reboot or fundamental redesign, I don't think users should depend on modding to salvage an increasingly obsolete experience.

As a player I appreciate the attention to detail in recreating European landscapes, the variety of trucks and customization options, as well as the immersive driving experience. To enhance the game further, future improvements could focus on expanding the map to include more regions, introducing dynamic weather and day-night cycles, and enhancing AI interactions for a more realistic traffic experience. Additionally, optimizing graphics and performance for a broader range of hardware would benefit players with varying system specifications.
In conclusions  I can say ETS2 has a solid foundation, and further developments in these areas could elevate the simulation experience.

Extremely relaxing to do a cross-country run with a podcast and a cup of hot chocolate. Played 4 hours of the demo, so total of 16 hours as I write this.

Pros:

- Very easy to run on older laptops. (Ex. 60 FPS on i7-6600U integrated)
- Huge map, with well worth DLC if on sale
- Relaxing game play that stays fun for hours at a time
- Mods add more to the game, and constant updates from devs keep things fresh

Cons:

- THIS IS NOT FOR EVERYONE: There is very little action or competitiveness, and slow progression. This is both to the games detriment and its success
- Outdated graphics (Easy to run but show their age)
- 70% of the map is payed DLC (The DLC is 100% worth it, but still)
- Not enough variation in game play. Its almost the same every time (However this is intentional)

Verdict:

85 / 100

(- 7 Graphics)
(- 2 Game play)
(- 6 Map DLC)

Euro Truck Simulator 2 Review: A Tranquil Journey on the Open Road

Pros:

Realistic Driving Experience: Euro Truck Simulator 2 (ETS2) provides a remarkably realistic driving experience, capturing the nuances of long-haul trucking. The attention to detail in vehicle physics, road dynamics, and weather effects contributes to an immersive simulation.

Expansive Map and Scenic Routes: The game features a vast and meticulously crafted map, offering scenic routes through various European landscapes. The attention to detail in city layouts, landmarks, and countryside visuals adds to the authenticity of the driving experience.

Vehicle Customization: ETS2 allows players to customize and upgrade their trucks, from aesthetic elements like paint and accessories to performance-enhancing modifications. This adds a personal touch to the gameplay and allows players to tailor their trucks to their preferences.

Relaxing Gameplay: The laid-back nature of the game makes it a unique and relaxing experience. The absence of time pressure and the option to enjoy the journey at one's own pace contribute to a therapeutic and stress-free gameplay environment.

Diverse Cargo and Jobs: The game offers a wide variety of cargo types and job contracts, providing players with the opportunity to explore different facets of the trucking industry. From transporting delicate goods to oversized loads, the diverse missions add depth to the gameplay.

Cons:

Limited Interaction Outside the Truck: While the focus is on the driving experience, some players may find the lack of meaningful interaction outside the truck limiting. More detailed depots, rest areas, or exploration elements could enhance the overall immersion.

Repetitive Tasks: The core gameplay loop involves driving from point A to point B, and some players may find the tasks repetitive over time. Additional mission variety or dynamic events on the road could mitigate this aspect.

Graphics and Animation Quality: While the graphics are generally good, ETS2's visuals might feel somewhat dated compared to more recent simulation games. Improvements in graphics and animations could further elevate the overall presentation.

Learning Curve for Beginners: For players unfamiliar with truck simulation games, the initial learning curve can be steep. A more comprehensive and interactive tutorial system might help newcomers ease into the complexities of truck driving and management.

Conclusion:

Euro Truck Simulator 2 delivers a serene and authentic trucking experience that caters to a niche audience seeking a laid-back simulation. The game's realistic driving mechanics, expansive map, and customizable trucks contribute to its charm. While some may find the gameplay repetitive, ETS2's unique appeal lies in its tranquil atmosphere and the joy of exploring the open road. For those looking to unwind with a leisurely virtual road trip, Euro Truck Simulator 2 remains a standout choice in the simulation genre.

it might sound clichè or even downright stupid, but this simulator changed my life. I have spent literal days travelling  with my steering wheel around the continent (thanks to the IMMENSE Promods expansion) listening to music, watching youtube in the background and (in 2021 while locked at home) studying for my university exams: it was nothing short of perfection. There has never been another simulator that has given me this kind of feeling, travelling by myself in a huge world with nothing but my own thoughts and the wonderful landscape as companion - or with friends on the TMP servers, laughing and chatting about nothing and everything. The gameplay might be very repetitive, but there's just something special about ETS2 and i owe a lot to SCS for giving me so many amazing memories.

ETS2 rating: 9/10; see other [url=https://store.steampowered.com/curator/44763882-Sim-Reviews/?appid=2014780]Sim Reviews[/url]

[i]TLDR: [b]Euro Truck Simulator 2[/b] - start off with a basic truck, but as you complete more deliveries, you earn money to upgrade your truck or even buy new ones, and later you manage your own delivery business. Euro Truck Simulator 2 takes you behind the wheel of a colossal rig, where slow burns and meticulous maneuvers reign supreme. This game isn't about adrenaline; it's about mastery, precision, and feeling the satisfying rumble of a 40-ton beast beneath your fingertips.[/i]

Euro Truck Simulator 2, developed by SCS Software, is more than just a driving game; it's a virtual exploration of European roads with a business management twist. This game offers an immersive experience for anyone who dreams of commanding an 18-wheeler through the diverse landscapes of Europe.

[b]Gameplay and Mechanics[/b]

You begin with a modest truck, earning your keep by delivering goods. Each successful delivery adds to your wallet, allowing you to upgrade your truck or buy new ones. But it's not just about driving – you're also in charge of your own delivery business. It's a slow but rewarding process, turning your one-man operation into a thriving logistics empire.

The game stands out for its attention to detail. Driving feels real – every truck has its unique handling, and the weight of your cargo affects your driving experience. It's about mastering the gears, understanding the power of air brakes, and handling every turn and stop with precision.

The game's control system is quite versatile: you can opt for a simple keyboard and mouse setup or go for a full-blown steering wheel and pedal setup for a more authentic experience. The game also supports head-tracking devices, which add to the immersion. I've mostly used an Xbox controller with a webcam for headtracking.

ETS2 is also about managing your trucking business. You can take bank loans, purchase trucks, hire drivers, and eventually build your own logistics company. The economic aspect is well-designed, providing a gradual progression from a lone driver to a business mogul. 

[b]Graphics and Sound[/b]

ETS2 offers stunning and accurately represented landscapes, cityscapes, and famous landmarks. The level of detail in the environmental design is impressive. Weather effects like rain and fog are not only visually impactful but also affect driving conditions, adding to the realism. Textures for roads, buildings, and vegetation still look good, creating a sense of authenticity. 

The day and night cycle, along with dynamic weather, ensures that no two journeys are the same. Driving through the misty mornings of the English countryside or the sun-drenched highways of Italy, each journey offers a unique visual treat.

While Euro Truck Simulator 2 might not boast cutting-edge graphics of the latest AAA titles, it excels in creating a cohesive and realistic atmosphere through a blend of detailed environments, dynamic weather, and immersive sound design. There are some limitations like jagged edges and low-poly models in some areas.

Trucks feature unique and realistic engine sounds that vary depending on engine type, load, and driving conditions. The rumble of the engine becomes an integral part of the gameplay experience. Wind, rain, and bird calls create a dynamic soundscape that adds to the immersion. Changing road surfaces like gravel or cobblestone have distinct audio cues. The radio offers a diverse selection of licenced music with various genres.

[b]Customisation[/b]

Customisation is another strong point of the game. You can customise your trucks extensively, from engines to paint jobs. Truck customisation options are quite extensive, allowing you to showcase your unique style and preferences.

You can choose from a wide range of colours and designs, including solid colours, metallic finishes, and more intricate designs. Some designs are inspired by real-world truck livery, while others are unique to the game. You can apply decals, decorate the cab interior with toys or devices like laptops and customise dashboards.

Adding auxiliary lights, such as roof-mounted spotlights or LED strips, enhances the truck's appearance and improves visibility during night driving. Different styles and colours of headlights not only change the appearance of the truck but also affect visibility in different weather conditions.

Upgrading the engine can improve speed, acceleration, and overall performance. This is particularly useful for hauling heavier loads or improving fuel efficiency. Customising the transmission can affect how the truck handles different terrains and loads, offering a balance between power and fuel economy. Changing the chassis can alter the truck's turning radius, stability, and ability to handle different types of cargo.

Finally, you can upgrade accessories - custom wheels, tires, hubcaps, exhausts, front grills, light bars, and more. You can modify trucks to look more rugged, sleek, or even flashy.

[b]Content and Modding[/b]

The modding community and the integration of Steam Workshop play a crucial role in enhancing and expanding the sim's capabilities, with thousands of mods available to customise your gameplay.

The game's developer has released a variety of DLCs since the game's launch, each bringing unique features and content. Expansion packs add new territories, cargo and trailer types, and paint jobs and customisations. The regional expansions not only add new geography but also include regional changes in traffic rules, road types and tolls, ferry transport, and more, enhancing the authenticity of the experience. The base game map has received updates and improvements over time, while some older DLCs are being reworked to match the newer standards. Keep an eye out for updates and news from the developers to get the most out of your experience.

[b]Multiplayer[/b]

The multiplayer aspect is hugely popular. It allows you to convoy with friends or strangers, adding a social element to the long hauls. Multiplayer extends beyond simple cruising. Join forces with your crew to tackle challenging contracts together. Combine resources, strategise deliveries, and witness your collective company rise to new heights.

You can spice up your trucking experience with community-organised events and races. Test your skills against other drivers in coast-to-coast contests, participate in themed convoys like "Neon Trucks at Night," and discover new ways to enjoy the game with others.

[b]Overall[/b]

ETS2 is accessible to a broad audience. It strikes a balance between being a relaxing game for casual players who just want to drive through beautiful landscapes and a detailed simulator for enthusiasts who enjoy the nitty-gritty of truck mechanics and business management. It's is a beautifully crafted game that goes beyond traditional gaming boundaries. It’s a blend of relaxation, adventure, strategy, and simulation. Whether it’s the joy of navigating a 40-ton truck through narrow streets or the satisfaction of building a thriving business, ETS2 delivers an engaging and surprisingly therapeutic experience. For anyone with even a passing interest in simulation games or driving, this is a journey worth taking.

Stages of Euro Truck Simulator 2 players:

Stage #1 

- Plays on a crappy old laptop, barely able to run it with 30 fps, all settings on minimum, 720p is a luxury, handles the truck with keyboard only, crashes a lot, doesn't take career any seriously, Shifts and everything else is automated as the game was on easy difficulty, doesn't use any mods. Probably between 10-50 hours of playtime.

Stage #2

- Plays on a mid-tier PC, is able to run the game on 1080p with constant 60 fps on high settings, handles the truck with keyboard and mouse, tries his best to not crash or violate any traffic laws, and takes career somewhat seriously. Shifts and most truck-related settings are set to manual, and uses a few Workshop mods. Probably between 50-150 hours of playtime.

Stage #3

- Plays on high-end PC, is able to run the game on 2K or 4K with constant 120 fps on ultra settings, handles the truck with a real force-feedback wheel like Logitech or Thrustmaster, almost never makes any mistakes during delivery. All truck-related settings are manual for him, uses as many Workshop mods as it makes sense, and the mods folder is loaded with ProMods files. Probably between 150-250 hours of playtime.

Stage #4

- Plays on god-tier PC, doesn't use flatscreen monitors anymore, uses one of the best VR headsets available on the market, handles the truck with a force-feedback wheel and a manual gear shifter as well. His settings are the result of carefully curated settings that been put together by years of ETS2 experience, all the mods are pushing the game to it's possible limits for truck driving simulation, and inside the headset the game looks as sharp and fluid with a high framerate that it makes the user forget reality. Probably between 250-1500 hours of playtime.

Stage #5

- Gives up on virtual reality truck driving, sells his house and belongings, leaves job and wife, buys a truck and becomes a real-life truck driver. Probably between 1500-lifetime hours of real life.

Me between stage #3 and #4

I suppose I will have to say 'Recommended' because I'm sure plenty of folk will get a lot from this driving game. I drove about for a while and got to grips with manoeuvring my vehicle, delivering plenty of loads. But after a while I got bored. In fact, I fell asleep at the wheel. This was so dangerous that I decided to be an honourable citizen and uninstall the game in case I caused another accident!

Coming back to the game over a year later it's been improved but I think the settings interfaces are cluttered. If you like flight simulators with every conceivable control then this is for you. I prefer a straightforward driving experience with a good amount of settings but not innumerable options. Also these juggernauts are a bit too wide for many roads in my view, especially when turning right at lights with traffic about. I used a gamepad with keyboard but could not get an accurate steering setting. Often turning was too slow and laboured whereas on other roads it was too severe (under the same setting that is). I got fed up changing the dozens of settings after a time.

The graphics are excellent, which is about the best I can say for this game.

Euro Truck Simulator 2 is a great truck driving simulation game! Driving around Europe, going through capital cities and small towns is something that no other game can do better than Euro Truck Simulator 2. Every city, town, village is very detailed. Truck customization is great even greater when you buy a few customization DLCs. Listening to the radio, truck engine, etc. is amazing, immersing you into a life of trucking! The gameplay is dynamic and you always have to drive from point A to point B, passing beautiful scenery and going through cities and small towns. However after some time the game may get a bit boring and repetitive. Thankfully there are many map and job DLCs, and mods. Multiplayer is there too, making the game more lively. All in all Euro Truck Simulator 2 is a game worth buying and worth spending time on. Worth 20€, but some DLCs could be a bit cheaper!

This game is definitely worth adding to your collection. The devs are always working to improve, and add new features & content to the game. There's a unique calming effect this game has on you cruising from country to country delivering goods. As long as you don't try to yeet your truck off a bridge, the economy is very forgiving and easy to grow in.

There are also a lot of settings you can tweak to personalize your experience more, for example road events like detours can be increased or decreased to fit your preference of difficulty. You can also increase the chances of rain if you enjoy driving in it, you likewise can decrease it if you dislike driving in in-climate weather. I personally play using an Xbox controller, and i love that i can easily set all my important key binds to my controller using whichever buttons or joy sticks i want.  

all in all 10/10, i highly recommend the map expansion dlcs as well, happy trucking!
i have loved playing this game

I bought this a while back after one of my mates was gassing it up, although it was chill I was never able to get fully into it playing on a keyboard...

Just recently I got myself a steering wheel and bought a few bangers to go with it, whilst downloading them I decided to give this another try seeing as I now had the wheel, absolutely 0 regrets.

Cruising through lanes in different countries across Europe with the steering wheel is genuinely the most laid-back fun I've had in all my years of gaming, the wheel was super easy to set up and aside from having to set a few buttons and having to switch a few game settings (I'd recommend turning off the truck speed limiter AND allowing time zones), everything else can be left untouched.

Right off the bat the game has you working as a sub-contractor for other companies, by the time you've done your first few missions the bank will make available to you a higher loan arrangement which will cover you for a garage upgrade, a couple of trucks and a potential new employee. From here you can get your company started up and there's honestly nothing complicated about it, the whole process is pretty straight forward and barely needs any explaining.

Online play is jokes and all, I've had some right shits and giggles doing contracts with mates, unfortunately you can't share contracts with friends if the contracts require skills they don't have, keep this in mind for anyone looking to play with their mates online.

The map in general is pretty bless, being a literal truck simulator game you can probably imagine that you're going to spend a lot of time on the open road where there's going to be a lot of open fields and foresty areas, but dotted around there's actually some really nice scenic locations that are so nice to drive around.

One thing I would say is that I'm not a fan of the big signs that are put up all over roads to prevent the player from going out of bounds, don't get me wrong I understand that the devs don't want to spend time working on an irrelevant area of the game, but when I'm on the road swinging about on a truck, one of the last things that I want to see is a big fuck off from all of the devs reminding me that I can't just go wherever I want, these signs can be a bit much at times and make the experience feel rather linear (although I promise it's not, the map is actually quite large and diverse and there is a lot to explore).

As of the time of me writing this review I don't have any of the DLC so I don't know if this is just an issue with the old map content, but to say the very least cities do a pretty convincing job of looking impressive on the way into them and then fall completely short the moment you're driving through them, once you're actually inside of a city you realise that just like much of the map there's only a few directions to go and it's not exactly like you can just wander off and "explore" a city. A good example of this is London, on your way up there it looks bustling, by the time you're driving through it you realise it's not long before you're out of London again.

For just short of £30 for the base game and all DLC I really can't see any reason as to why I wouldn't recommend this game, for how a truck simulator could go this is pretty fucking on point, pull out penjamin and get a few blinkers down the hatch and next thing you know you're speeding through Germany.

This is going to be a bit long, so bear with me. I love playing racing games—the speed, the cars, and the modifications. But then I came across this hidden gem. I can't believe how much I actually enjoyed playing this game. I got it on sale, and I can say that after about 40 hours, I would pay the full price for it. It's so immersive, especially with the tons of mods you can run. From time to time, it can get a bit repititave, but I just take breaks, and the next day, I'm just excited to embark on a journey again, get fined for speeding, crash and go repair, get sleepy, and find a place to park, rest, and tank. Not to mention, I loved the fact that the world has my home town, and it's so nice to drive on the same streets, which I usually use to get to work almost every day. I would recommend this game all day, every day, hands down. It does take a little bit of time to get used to it, but it's so worth it and fulfilling after a certain point. Also, there are so many DLCs, and the community is great; not to mention, you can also do convoys with other people, and the developers are constantly behind the game, updating it. It's just a great game. 9.8/10

Hands down the best simulator in the market. Personally, I love coming back home after managing truck drivers for 9-10 hours in a logistics company just to play some Euro Truck Simulator 2 for another 5. 
Pro tip: find the weirdest radio station possible and haul some crap your whole evening while listening to it - very meditative, trust me. I don't recommend playing this game with keyboard and mouse, if possible - buy a steering wheel with pedals. 
Also, have to mention that some cities are way too small and underdeveloped (yeah you won't see any trucks in a city center, but come on some capital cities have merely 3 buildings, while tiny towns are fully equipped with infrastructure). Game definitely lacks some "events" while on the road, such as: random tire blowouts, random engine/ABS lights turning on or other annoying mechanical issues. Would also be cool to do some tedious documents at shippers and/or receivers. Anyways, game's a 10/10, try it out, especially when on sale!

[h3] Review of ETS2 (Euro Truck Simulator 2) [/h3]
[b]What is it about?[/b] The game is about to make an simulation of driving an truck. You drive around the Europe and deliver. Most of the time you spend making money or costumising truck. It's really good game only if you like trucks. There are truck companies such as Scania, Volvo, Man, Mercedes, Iveco.

[b]What about mods?[/b]
The game has mods. There are 2. options how to get mods. 1. You will download then from the workshop, and the 2nd way is to download them from the internet and paste them into the mods folder.

[b]Price[/b]
The price is probably normal price for game. If you don't want to spend 20$ wait till there will be an sale. When is sale all of the DLC's and the price of the game will get down. Then it's sale it cost 5$.

This is probably all from the game. And now let's get to the things that I like and don't like.

[b]Thing that I like:[/b]
1. Big map even if it has no DLC's
2. Alot of costumisations for a truck. (I recommend to buy an DLC's for tuck costumisation.)
3. You can choose what truck you want.
4. It's multiplayer so you can play with your friend's.
5. Very good looking map.
6. Alot of cities and countries.

Now the thing that I don't like:
1. Not so much realistic without a gaming wheel or mod's
2. Weather is not that brutal.
3. You cannot get out of the truck and connect trailer by yourself.

[u][b] Overall rating: 8.1/10 [/b][/u]

Fair to say I've had no actual experience operating articulated vehicles in RL. But I have to admit, with a little patience and perseverance, one can quickly master the basics and move onto more advanced challenges. I don't have the fastest latest gaming PC, but that hasn't marred the overall average 70 fps gameplay and quiet realistic immersive graphics quality.

It's has an easy to use UI and clear narration throughout the initial game & profile setup, explaining jobs and operator tasks is also easy for a noob like me to follow. I can't offer much in the way of input about the game, as I haven't played it long enough to form a constructive opinion either way, with only an hour or so behind the wheel. I can say though, that I'm extremely happy with a game I only paid £4.22p to experience....

A wonderful game to take off a couple ounces of stress in any given day. Whether you're deep into 18-wheeler lore, or just want the serenity of driving across countries, with a singular goal in mind, this game is here for you.
Obviously, there's not much more than the title here - you drive truck, earn money, get better truck, then go into some management of your company via employees and truck beds, but really, you just wanna keep driving truck. Truck can become cooler-looking, but you still drive truck.
Similarly obvious is that it gets repetitive relatively quick, but that's the case with a lot of games that are good still. You just have to find your own pace, to find periods of time to let a game sit still, then come back to it fresh and intrigued, even for a couple of hours at a time.

Personally, I merge in my own music and take whatever the longest job is to check out the views and hear the hum of the engine for a while. But you do you. Whatever helps you get a bit of rest from the world, take a load off.
The game is very nice by physics and UI.

[h1] Euro Truck Simulator 2 [/h1]

[h3]Pros: [/h3] [b]🚚 Drive Trucks in Europe[/b] Euro Truck Simulator 2 is a simulation game where players deliver important cargo by driving trucks in Europe. Driving in different and realistic environments, interacting with other vehicles on the road and following traffic rules can give players a realistic experience. 🌍🚦

[b]👔 Build Your Own Business[/b] The game offers a system where players can build and manage their own businesses. Building a fleet of trucks, buying garages, hiring drivers and managing their company to reach the highest profit can offer players a strategic experience. 💰👍

[h3] Cons: [/h3] [b]🎮 Repetitive Gameplay Mechanics[/b] The game's gameplay mechanics can be repetitive for some players. Controlling the truck with only the directional buttons and delivering loads can reduce the fun level of the game. It may not be satisfying for players who expect more gameplay variety. 😴👎

[b]🖼️ Old Graphics and Details[/b] The graphics and details may be dated for some players. The game was released in 2012 and was designed according to the standards of the time. It may not be satisfying for players who expect higher quality graphics and details. 😡👎

[h3] Other Bad Points: [/h3] [b]⏳ A Long Game[/b] The duration of the game can be too long for some players. It can take hundreds of hours to finish the game. A shorter and more concise game may be desired. ⏰⌛

[b]🎶 Ordinary Sound and Music[/b] The sound and music elements of the game can be considered ordinary or forgettable. A more original sound design that will reinforce the atmosphere of the game may be preferred. 🔉❌

[b]Good Points[/b]
[list]
[*]Drive a truck in Europe.
[*]Start your own business.
[*]A realistic simulation.
[*]Different environments and scenarios.
[*]Customize your trucks.
[/list]
[b]Bad Aspects[/b]
[list]
[*]Repetitive gameplay mechanics.
[*]Outdated graphics and details.
[*]A long running game.
[*]Mediocre sound and music.
[/list]

Euro Truck Simulator 2: Rule the Road Like Never Before!

Embark on an exhilarating journey across Europe in Euro Truck Simulator 2, where you step into the shoes of a trucker entrusted with delivering crucial cargo across expansive distances. Traverse more than 60 cities, including destinations in the UK, Belgium, Germany, Italy, the Netherlands, Poland, and beyond. Test your endurance, skill, and speed as you navigate the roads and prove yourself as the elite force behind the wheel!

Key Features:

Diverse Cargo Delivery: Transport a vast array of cargo, showcasing your driving prowess across a multitude of European cities.

Business Expansion: Run and manage your own growing business as you complete freight deliveries. Expand your fleet, acquire garages, hire drivers, and optimize your company for maximum profitability.

Truck Tuning: Personalize your trucks with a range of tuning options, from performance enhancements to cosmetic changes. Add lights, bars, horns, beacons, smoke exhausts, and more to make your vehicles stand out.

Real Road Networks: Navigate thousands of miles of authentic road networks, featuring renowned landmarks and structures that bring the European landscape to life.

World of Trucks: Immerse yourself in the online community of Euro Truck Simulator 2 through World of Trucks. Capture and share the best moments using in-game Photo Mode, and discuss your screenshots with fellow virtual truckers.

Additional Features: Utilize custom avatars and license plates in the game, and enjoy Editor's Picks – a selection of the best images hand-picked by the game creators, updated almost daily.

Join the World of Trucks community by signing up with your Steam account, although registration is optional to play the game. Euro Truck Simulator 2 awaits those who have the mettle to rule the road and become a trucking legend!

[h1]Scootaloo's Review of Euro Truck Simulator 2: A HowlStrom Expedition[/h1]

Greetings, fellow gamers and denizens of the icy HowlStrom! I'm Scootaloo, a 19-year-old school-age Pegasus pony, who's been gaming all my life. Living with the ice wolf clan under the guidance of Kiba Snowpaw, I've embarked on a virtual journey through Europe in the driver's seat of "Euro Truck Simulator 2" by SCS Software. Let me share with you my detailed critique and experience.

[h2]Setting off on the European Roads[/h2]
"Euro Truck Simulator 2" offers an open-road experience that mirrors the freedom I feel soaring above HowlStrom. As a Pegasus accustomed to the thrill of flight, the transition to ruling the roads as a trucker was an unexpected yet engaging shift.

[h3]Gameplay: A Symphony of Driving Dynamics[/h3]
The game's core lies in its realistic simulation of truck driving across Europe. Each city, from the UK to Poland, presents unique challenges and landscapes, akin to the diverse terrains of HowlStrom. The attention to detail in the truck's mechanics and the strategic planning required for successful deliveries resonated with my adventurous spirit.

[i]Strengths[/i]:
- The immersive driving experience, offering a sense of control and freedom
- Extensive customization options, allowing for a personal touch to each truck
- A vast network of roads and cities, providing endless exploration opportunities
- Regular updates and expansions, keeping the game fresh and engaging

[i]Weaknesses[/i]:
- Occasionally repetitive gameplay, which can feel like traversing the same snow-covered paths of HowlStrom
- A steep learning curve for beginners, much like learning to navigate the icy winds of my homeland

[h3]Visuals and Ambiance[/h3]
The game's graphics bring Europe to life with stunning realism. From bustling city streets to serene countryside, the visuals are a feast for the eyes, much like the majestic views of HowlStrom. The dynamic weather and day-night cycles add to the immersive experience.

[h3]Community and Multiplayer[/h3]
The addition of the Convoy multiplayer mode creates a sense of camaraderie among players, reminiscent of the pack mentality in HowlStrom. Sharing the road with friends enhances the gameplay, making each journey a shared adventure.

[h3]Scootaloo's Final Verdict[/h3]
"Euro Truck Simulator 2" is a captivating escape into the life of a trucker, offering a blend of relaxation and challenge. It's a testament to the joys of virtual exploration and the satisfaction of a job well done.

[b]Rating[/b]: [i]8.5 out of 10 HowlStrom Stars[/i]

In conclusion, "Euro Truck Simulator 2" is a game that offers a unique and engaging experience. It might not match the thrill of flying through HowlStrom, but it provides its own kind of adventure on the open roads of Europe.

[hr][/hr]
Scootaloo, the Trucking Pegasus of HowlStrom, signing off. 🐎🚚

The game is good if its on sales. But it has some big flaws as the game is pretty old already. 

For example, the cities in the game is poorly designed. You cannot enter the city centre and explore it, you can only see the landmarks from a distance. If you expect this game to have detailed cities then this game is not for you. (games like fernbus coach simulator has much better cities that you can actually explore, more landmarks and better looking textures). 

Plus the game feels very dead, there aren't much pedestrians on street and you would always have this strange feel of emptiness and awkwardness.

tbh this game is launched a long time ago and built with unity engine(kinda obsolete), mods can change it up a little bit but I can't find anything that can effectively solve the problems mentioned above. (1:1 map mod is not the solution)
